summary:
Calabria is a beautiful region in southern Italy, shaped like a boot. It's surrounded by seas and has a long history. Ancient Greeks gave Italy its name and started cities here. Later, it became part of the Roman Empire and then a Byzantine domain, keeping its Greek heritage.

This region has diverse people and languages, including Greek and Albanian speakers. It's known for its clear seas and ancient sites like castles and parks. Calabria also boasts three national parks, offering stunning nature and wildlife.
title: Calabria
